answers.answer: The only think I can think of other than birth control is maybe Yoga, or some other type of excercise. Exercising produces a natural hormone in your body to help balance your other hormones.

My sister also has PCOS, she had to lose weight to get her period regular. Also I spoke with a doctor once (in a casual situation) who had done a thesis on it, she said drugs used to treat diabetes are sometimes used for patients with PCOS.

question: I have recently found out that i have PCOS. Lately I have been having really bad mood swings and dont know what to do about it. one minute im laughing then crying then yelling then depressed. i feel bad cuz i snap at my husband all the time and then feel bad for doing so. i havent had my period for 4 months so i know that might have something to do with it...my question is is there anyhing that i can do about my hormones being all wacked? i dont want to be on birth control either. thanks in advance.
title: hormones out of Wack
